entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text:
Firefighters are sending two high volume pumps to Sykehouse in Doncaster to aid the removal of surface water which is currently lying on flood plains in the area.

We're working with @MyDoncaster, @nottsfire and @EnvAgencyYNE on this.

More here üëá

https://t.co/eEZkSc00Am https://t.co/howIP6kCGS

@WildStoke @StaffsUni @TalesofaWildGuy @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @TrentCaba @jogideon Be good to see more reported on this. Sounds like an area other projects may be able to learn from. The most useful bits of evaluation are often where things didn‚Äôt perform exactly as expected.

@MtbSprocket @DaveThroupEA @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @isbournecatch @GlosCC @TewkesburyBCgov This is a DEFRA funded pilot project, of which there are several around the country. The findings from the past three years have been really positive and certainly within Worcestershire this approach to water management will be more widespread going forward.

Accurate knowledge about when and where #flooding has happened is so important. Anyone can use the Flood Online Reporting Tool, and it all helps to inform flood risk mitigation now and in the future @EnvAgencySW 
https://t.co/IfTaMkxrN4
@HighwaysEngland @EnvAgency @NorfolkCC I‚Äôm tweeting everyone I can find as nothing is being done but thank you

text: @WildStoke @StaffsUni @TalesofaWildGuy @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @TrentCaba @jogideon I saw quite a bit of erosion of the banks of the Victoria Ground new river channel. Will try and take photos next time I pass by. Any plans to repair/stabilise? More positively construction of the new river side path along the edge of the housing site looked well underway.

@MrTimDunn The Ouse Washes are doing their job and what they are designed to do. Saves my house from flooding! @EnvAgency have done a great job raising banks this year for future-proofing rising water levels.
@JulesWS1976 @EnvAgency @JulesWS1976 @EnvAgency Hello Jules, thank you for your tweet. @NorfolkCC will be able to assist you here. We at Highways England do not maintain this road. Thank you

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text: RT @CityofTreesMcr: Huge thank-you to @HelenSkelton for doing an amazing job presenting today‚Äôs @BBCCountryfile and for braving the element‚Ä¶

urls.title: Education & Learning Packs - Unlocking the Severn
urls.description: Education packs to introduce learners to the world of water and rivers. From the wonderful water cycle to river friendly farming, engineering a fish pass to designing your own river! For teachers and home-schoolers, these are jam packed with engaging activities and dotted with fun facts to keep children engaged.

text: Last year, the storm overflow at our local sewage treatment works at Milton dumped untreated sewage into the limestone River Evenlode for 2060 hours. Yes that's >23% of the year! Thanks to @thameswater. Taskforce that @pow_rebecca @EnvAgency #sewage
